messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: dishes and things we hate to do
messages.msgSnippet: ... don t ... hate ... Some things I HATE to do are scrubbing potatoes (like if I m going to make baked potatoes), washing lettuce for salad and grating
messages.messageBody:
> I HATE taking the dishes out of the dishwasher and putting them away. I
don't
> mind folding clothes, but I hate to put them away. The boys (my husband's
> included in "my boys") know that and sweetly DO it. They know how much I
hate
> it.
>
> I'm thrilled to do the things THEY hate. It's a matter of kindness. And
> generosity.
>
> ~Kelly



Some things I HATE to do are scrubbing potatoes (like if I'm going to make
baked potatoes), washing lettuce for salad and grating cheese. When my
husband offers to do these things for me that I hate, I KNOW that he loves
me. <g>

Karin
